repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Dick J. Reavis Freedom of Information-Privacy Acts (FOIPA) Request Files on Mildred McAdory

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dick J. Reavis in 2009. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2009.063 and 2009.097.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mildred McAdory, known as Mildred Edelman, was apparently a member of the Communist Party, USA who was active in the Southern Negro Youth Congress. In 1943 she was arrested for violating segregation ordinances on a Birmingham, Alabama city bus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains FBI files on Mildred McAdory, known as Mildred Edelman, principaly after she moved to New York City. The files were received in two accessions, the second containing photocopies of many photographs of McAdory and others.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1940s-ca.1960, are expected to enter the public domain in 2080.
